properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 11:26AM EST by NWS State College PA
properties.description:
HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 35 MPH which
can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile.

LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1121 AM EST, a snow squall was along a
line extending from near Cuba to 6 miles northwest of Keeneyville and
moving east southeast at 40 MPH.

LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE...
Mansfield, Wellsboro, Elkland, Blossburg, Galeton, Shinglehouse,
Westfield, Genesee, Lawrenceville, Gaines, Covington, Arnot,
Millerton, Keeneyville, Harrison Valley, Leonard Harrison State Park,
Tioga, Knoxville, Ulysses and Roseville.

This includes the following highways...
Route 6 from Walton to the Bradford county line.
Route 15 from Blossburg to Lawrenceville.

SAFETY INFO...
Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall.
Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to
lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this squall passes
your location.

If you recognize an approching snow squall by terrain or trees
becoming obscured a mile or 2 ahead, slow down and put on your
emergency flashers. Gradually reducing your speed, or exiting the
roadway for a brief break until the squall passes, will greatly
reduce the threat for serious multi-vehicle accidents.

NWSheadline: A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF POTTER AND TIOGA COUNTIES
